input.text_prompt:
System / Context:
You are an expert Senior Java Software Engineer specializing in desktop application development using JavaFX 25 and Java 24. Your task is to generate a production-ready, fully functional desktop application based on the provided Technical Specifications, Functional Requirements, and UI Assets.
Technical Constraints & Environment:
JDK Version: Java 24.
Library: OpenJFX 25.0.1.
Build Tool: Maven 3.9.11.
Code Completeness: You must provide the full, compilable source code. Do not use placeholders like // ... rest of code. Do not omit imports.
Visuals: Do not use external image files (PNG/JPG). Use the provided SVG XML code blocks for all icons to ensure the app runs immediately without missing assets.
Project Scope:
Application Name: 2D Drawing App
Description: This is a 2D drawing application that allows users to create art using standard tools, shapes, and immediate color controls including hue, saturation, and brightness settings.
Section 1: Functional Requirements:
Implement the following logic strictly. The code must satisfy every ID listed below:
FR1.1: The system must allow the user to select and use a Pencil tool for freehand drawing.
FR1.2: The system must allow the user to select and use an Eraser tool to remove existing marks from the canvas.
FR1.3: The system must allow the user to select and draw basic geometric shapes, specifically a Circle/Oval.
FR1.4: The system must allow the user to select and draw basic geometric shapes, specifically a Triangle.
FR1.5: The system must allow the user to select and use a Text tool to place text onto the canvas.
FR2.1: The user must be able to undo the last action performed on the canvas.
FR2.2: The user must be able to redo the last undone action.
FR2.3: The user must be able to export the final drawing from the canvas into image format (PNG).
FR3.1: The user must be able to select a primary color using a 2D Color Picker (Hue/Saturation/Value or HSL).
FR3.2: The user must be able to adjust the Hue of the selected color using a separate Rainbow Slider.
FR3.3: The user must be able to adjust the Opacity/Transparency of the current tool/object using a slider control.
FR3.4: The system must display the Fill Color (used for shapes or the Fill tool) and allow the user to set it.
FR3.5: The system must display the Outline Color (used for shape borders or the Pencil/Brush) and allow the user to set it.
FR3.6: The user must be able to adjust the Line Thickness (Stroke Weight) for drawing tools and shapes using a slider control.
FR3.7: The user must click either the Fill or Outline preview box to select the active color target before adjusting color.
FR3.8: After a target is selected, any adjustments made in the color picker (2D selector or hue slider) must immediately update the selected target’s color.
FR3.9: The color picker must always remain visible on screen.
FR3.10: If the user adjusts the color picker when no target is selected, no color changes must occur.
Section 2: UI & Wireframe Specifications:
The GUI must strictly adhere to the attached visual wireframe.
Layout Structure:
The application follows a classic desktop interface layout with a clean, white background. It is divided into four distinct sections: a top navigation bar, a left-hand tool sidebar, a central canvas, and a right-hand property/color panel. Top Navigation Bar
Located at the very top of the window, running horizontally:
Branding: The logo "Paint+" is displayed in the top-left corner (with a stylized plus sign).
Action Menu: To the right of the logo, there are text-based action buttons: Undo, Redo, and Export
Left Toolbar (Tools)
A narrow vertical column on the left side containing icons for drawing tools. From top to bottom: Pencil/Freehand, Rectangle (Active), Circle/Ellipse, Triangle, Eraser, and Text. the active tool should have grey background color to indicate it’s selected
Center Workspace (Canvas)
The majority of the screen is occupied by the drawing area.
Canvas: A large, white rectangular area bordered by a thin black line, representing the active drawing surface.
Right Sidebar (Properties & Colors)
A wider vertical column on the right containing configuration settings for the selected tool.
Color Picker:
Gradient Box: A large square showing a saturation/brightness gradient.
Hue Slider: A graphical spectrum bar that clearly shows the full range of colors (Rainbow) in its background, allowing the user to select the base hue..
Opacity: A slider control labeled "Opacity," currently set to 100%.
Color Indicators:
Fill: A rectangular swatch labeled "Fill," currently showing Red.
Outline: A rectangular swatch labeled "Outline," currently showing Black.
Line Thickness: A slider control labeled "Line Thickness," currently set to 76%.
Styling: Strictly mimic the color palette, typography, corner roundness, and element spacing visible in the attached wireframe image. The visual output should look as close to the image as possible.
Window Size: 1440 width x 1024 height.
Section 3: Graphic Assets (SVG Paths):
Use the following SVG XML code blocks for the application icons:
pencil icon: <svg width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="none" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"> <path d="M13.6286 4.37035L19.6294 10.3714L6.59893 23.4024L1.24876 23.993C0.532526 24.0722 -0.072614 23.4666 0.0070714 22.7503L0.602368 17.3962L13.6286 4.37035ZM23.3408 3.47689L20.5233 0.659191C19.6444 -0.21973 18.2189 -0.21973 17.3401 0.659191L14.6893 3.31002L20.6901 9.31105L23.3408 6.66023C24.2197 5.78084 24.2197 4.35581 23.3408 3.47689Z" fill="black"/> </svg>

triangle icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" fill="currentColor" class="bi bi-triangle" viewBox="0 0 16 16"> <path d="M7.938 2.016A.13.13 0 0 1 8.002 2a.13.13 0 0 1 .063.016.15.15 0 0 1 .054.057l6.857 11.667c.036.06.035.124.002.183a.2.2 0 0 1-.054.06.1.1 0 0 1-.066.017H1.146a.1.1 0 0 1-.066-.017.2.2 0 0 1-.054-.06.18.18 0 0 1 .002-.183L7.884 2.073a.15.15 0 0 1 .054-.057m1.044-.45a1.13 1.13 0 0 0-1.96 0L.165 13.233c-.457.778.091 1.767.98 1.767h13.713c.889 0 1.438-.99.98-1.767z"/> </svg>

Output Deliverables:
Provide the output in the following format:
pom.xml: Complete Maven configuration.
Main.java: The entry point extending Application.
Controller/View Classes: If separating concerns, provide clearly marked files.
styles.css: (If used).

execution.failure_reason: COMPILATION ERROR, The application failed to compile due to a syntax error in the array declaration on line 266

input.text_prompt:
The application failed to compile due to a syntax error in the array declaration on line 266:
Error: [ERROR] /D:/LLM_JavaFX_Applications/Drawing_App/src/main/java/com/paintplus/PaintPlusApp.java:[266,20] ']' expected
The exact line throwing the error is: double[ xPoints = { x1, x2, (x1 + x2) / 2 };
Please analyze this syntax error and regenerate the updated files required to fix this compilation issue.

execution.failure_reason: FAILED FUNCTIONAL TEST, Critical parts of the Graphical User Interface (GUI) are rendering out of the defined window boundaries, making the application unusable.

input.text_prompt:
The application launched successfully but failed the manual user interaction tests.
FAILURE REASON: Critical parts of the Graphical User Interface (GUI) are rendering out of the defined window boundaries, making the application unusable.
SPECIFIC ERRORS:
The primary drawing canvas is partially out of view.
The toolbox icons are scaled incorrectly, obscuring a significant portion of the screen and preventing access to most drawing tools.
Functional Check: None of the drawing tools (e.g., pen, eraser, shapes) are responsive or initiate drawing when used on the canvas.
Please analyze these functional and layout errors and regenerate the updated files required to achieve a fully usable, correctly laid-out application.

execution.failure_reason: FAILED FUNCTIONAL TEST, Critical parts of the Graphical User Interface (GUI) are rendering out of the defined window boundaries, making the application unusable.

input.text_prompt:
The application launched and several core tools are now functional, which is a significant improvement. However, a new critical layout failure is preventing full usability:
FAILURE REASON: The Rectangle and Circle tools are taking up excessive vertical space in the toolbar.
SPECIFIC ERRORS:
The tools below the Circle tool (specifically the Triangle, Eraser, and Text tools) are pushed entirely out of the application window bounds and are inaccessible.
The toolbox layout must be adjusted to ensure all 6 tools are visible and accessible simultaneously within the window without requiring scrolling.
Please analyze this scaling and layout constraint error and regenerate the updated files required to achieve a fully usable, correctly laid-out application with all elements accessible.
